sentence.text: Patients who carry the collagen type IVA3 chain (activation of cysteine-type endopeptidase activity involved in apoptotic process) or glomerular basement membrane development mutations usually exhibit Alport Syndrome (AS), thin basement membrane neuropathy or familial hematuria (FH).

entity.text: activation of cysteine-type endopeptidase activity involved in apoptotic process

sentence.text: Genomic DNA of the siblings affected by FH with biopsy-proven FSGS was analyzed, and their father was screened for 18 gene mutations associated with FSGS [nephrin, podocin, CD2 associated protein, phospholipase C e, actinin a 4, transient receptor potential cation channel subfamily C member 6, inverted formin, FH2 and WH2 domain containing, Wilms tumor 1, LIM homeobox transcription factor 1 b, laminin subunit b 2, laminin subunit b 3, galactosida a, integrin subunit b 4, scavenger receptor class B member 2, coenzyme Q2, decaprenyl diphosphate synthase subunit 2, mitochondrially encoded tRNA leucine 1 (UUA/G; TRNL1) and chromatin remodeling/SNF related, matrix associated, actin dependent regulator of chromatin, subfamily a like 1] using matrix-assisted laser desorption/ionization time-of-flight mass spectrometry technology.
